The Fogg Behavior Model states that three things need to come together in order for a behavior to occur: 
 
 1.Motivation - Are you motivated enough to complete your task? 
 
 2.Ability - Are you actually capable of completing the task? 
 
 3.Trigger (a cue) - Have you set up a way to remember the task? 
 
 Fogg boiled down the things that stop you from completing tasks to the “Six Elements of Simplicity”: 
 
 1.Time 
 2.Money 
 3.Physical Effort 
 4.Brain Cycles (Mental Effort) 
 5.Social Deviance 
 6.Non-Routine
